title: Restore Version 14 (or lower) app naming and stabilize name-derived identifiers

requirements.summary: Restore the visible app name/branding across the HTML shell, boot fallback UI, and in-app header/footer to match Version 14 (or lower) naming consistently in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title matches the Version 14 (or lower) app name.
Boot fallback screen title text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently.
In-app header branding text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently (including responsive variants like short names).
In-app footer branding text uses the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently.
All user-facing naming text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a single source of truth for Version 14 (or lower) branding strings (e.g., full app name and responsive short name) to ensure consistent usage across UI surfaces.
Update the HTML document title and any relevant metadata/boot fallback title text to match the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently, in English.
Replace hardcoded header branding strings with values sourced from frontend/src/lib/appBranding.ts to ensure consistent full/short responsive naming.
Replace hardcoded footer branding strings with values sourced from frontend/src/lib/appBranding.ts so the footer displays the Version 14 (or lower) app name consistently.
Replace the hardcoded hero/title branding text with values sourced from frontend/src/lib/appBranding.ts to keep in-app visible naming consistent.
Update the static health page title and visible heading/copy that references the app name to match the Version 14 (or lower) naming consistently in English.
Update the user-facing diagnostics header text to use the Version 14 (or lower) app name via frontend/src/lib/appBranding.ts so diagnostics copy is consistent with the restored branding.

requirements.summary: Audit and revert name-derived identifiers referenced at startup (build identifier strings and any hostname/app-identifier derivations used in links or diagnostics) to Version 14 (or lower) values to prevent load regressions.
acceptanceCriteria: No startup-time runtime errors are caused by missing/renamed name-derived identifiers.
The app successfully mounts (fires the existing `app-mounted` signal) and the boot fallback screen hides on a normal load.
Any build/version/identifier values shown in the UI remain present and do not prevent load when changed.

file_operations.description: Add/confirm any non-UI name-derived constants needed to avoid ad-hoc string construction at startup (e.g., a stable, Version 14 (or lower) identifier-safe label for diagnostics/attribution text).

Audit build/version/identifier helpers to ensure they are resilient to missing/changed meta tags and do not throw at startup; keep build/version/identifier values present for UI display without affecting app mount.

Audit name-coupled startup references in the HTML shell (e.g., build-id meta usage and boot fallback script assumptions) and revert/align any identifier strings that must match Version 14 (or lower) values so the app mounts and the fallback hides on normal load.

Audit any hostname/app-identifier derivations used in outgoing links to ensure they are stable and not inadvertently coupled to the visible app name; keep attribution links functional after the naming rollback.

Ensure diagnostics text composition remains robust (no assumptions about renamed identifiers) while preserving build/version/identifier visibility; align any name-derived labels with frontend/src/lib/appBranding.ts.
